## Useful Info

**Mottled dragons** are one of the easier dragons you'll encounter. They have low [HP](/HP "HP"), [AC](/AC "AC"), and [EV](/EV "EV"), making them easy prey for most attacks. However, they can breathe [Sticky Flame](/Sticky_Flame "Sticky Flame") at you, dealing significant [fire](/Fire "Fire") damage over several turns.

Killing it may drop [mottled dragon scales](/Mottled_dragon_scales "Mottled dragon scales"), one of the better light armours in the game.

## Spells

| Spell set |                                                                      |                                                                                                           |
| :-------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Slot1     | [Sticky Flame Range](/Sticky_Flame_Range "Sticky Flame Range") (3d4) | [Natural flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags"), [Breath flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |

## Tips & Tricks

- Its Sticky Flame breath has a maximum range of 5 tiles. If you're a fast character, you can [kite](/Kite "Kite") them fairly easily. Otherwise, try to take them out before they get into range.
- [Fire resistance](/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance") will reduce its damage. [Mottled dragon armour](/Mottled_dragon_armour "Mottled dragon armour") will make the flame not "stick".

## History

- In [0.20](/0.20 "0.20"), mottled dragons were replaced by [acid dragons](/Acid_dragon "Acid dragon").
- Prior to [0.19](/0.19 "0.19"), this dragon dropped a [mottled dragon hide](/Mottled_dragon_hide "Mottled dragon hide") that could be made into [mottled dragon armour](/Mottled_dragon_armour "Mottled dragon armour") with a [scroll of enchant armour](/Scroll_of_enchant_armour "Scroll of enchant armour").
- Prior to [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), this monster was greatly feared for its ability to [destroy your scrolls](/Item_destruction "Item destruction").

Mottled dragon

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Obsolete: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.

For a list of all dragons, see list of dragons.

mottled dragon D 
HP 18-37
HD 5
XP 167
Speed 10
AC 5
EV 10
Will 20
Attack1 15 (bite: plain)
Attack2 6 (claw: plain)


Resistances rF+
rPois+
rSticky
Vulnerabilities None
Habitat Land
Intelligence Animal
Uses Uses nothing
Holiness Natural
Size Big
Type dragon, mottled dragon
Flags Flying
Warm-blooded
A small purple dragon with curiously mottled scales, its mouth dripping with a strange liquid flame.

“On the other hand, Confucius is made to say to his disciples, ‘I know how birds can fly, how fishes can swim, and how animals can run. But the runner may be snared, the swimmer may be hooked, and the flyer may be shot by the arrow. But there is the dragon. I cannot tell how he mounts on the wind through the clouds, and rises to heaven. Today I have seen Lao-tsze, and can only compare him to the dragon.’”
-Life of Confucius

“This Dragon had Two furious Wings
Each one upon each Shoulder;
With a Sting in his Tail as long as a Flail,
Which made him bolder and bolder.
He had long Claws, and in his Jaws
Four and forty Teeth of Iron;
With a Hide as tough, as any Buff,
Which did him round environ.”

-“An Excellent Ballad of a most dreadful Combat, fought between Moore of Moore-Hall, and the Dragon of Wantley”, retold by Ambrose Philips, _A Collection of Old Ballads. Corrected from the Best and Most Ancient Copies Extant. With Introductions Historical, Critical, Or Humorous_. 1723.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Spells
  • 3 Tips & Tricks
  • 4 History

Useful Info

Mottled dragons are one of the easier dragons you'll encounter. They have low HP, AC, and EV, making them easy prey for most attacks. However, they can breathe Sticky Flame at you, dealing significant fire damage over several turns.

Killing it may drop mottled dragon scales, one of the better light armours in the game.

Spells

Spell set
Slot1 Sticky Flame Range (3d4) Natural flag,
Breath flag

Tips & Tricks

  • Its Sticky Flame breath has a maximum range of 5 tiles. If you're a fast character, you can kite them fairly easily. Otherwise, try to take them out before they get into range.
  • Fire resistance will reduce its damage. Mottled dragon armour will make the flame not "stick".

History

  • In 0.20, mottled dragons were replaced by acid dragons.
  • Prior to 0.19, this dragon dropped a mottled dragon hide that could be made into mottled dragon armour with a scroll of enchant armour.
  • Prior to 0.15, this monster was greatly feared for its ability to destroy your scrolls.
